data.title: Gypsy Message Board: The Ludari Gypsies are Senekerim Hovhannes or Yovanovich tribe or John tribe
data.text:
Ludari descend from House of Varaz Senekerim Hovhannes or Johns tribe

House of Varaz Senekerim Hovhannes or Yovanovich tribe or John tribe from

both the Yovanovich Yugoslavia and Stanko in Bulgaria and Stanescu or Stankovich tribes all the descend from Senekerim Hovhannes or Yovanovich or Stankovich or John tribe who carry both HLA-A2901(Solomon) and HLA-B4201 and mtDNA-LM11 from the Sassanian Persian female royal bloodline of Nazbanu the daughter of Yazdegerd III, Kouschkousch Bagratid( Gypsy Queen) B Rh negative, Senekerim Hovhannes Azdrurzi Vaspurkhan who went to Lustiana Portugal. The Stank or Yanko family in Bulgaria were B Rh negative like Stanca Basarab the ancestor Vlad Dracula and Boyar Stan or Stanescu family who both descended from Vlad Dracula B Rh negative and B Rh negative Gypsy Witch Mother from Bulagaria were She was the Stanko or Queen or Head of the Gypsy race in Bulgaria being a Noble Gypsy Witch and Boyar Stan family males also regularly intermarried with Gypsy women. The Stan Boyar or Stanescu women who had Gypsy Noble and Dracula Noble Gypsy blood intermarried with Boyars like Stanca Basarab who a Stanescu Boyar who married Logofat de Pitesti the Mayor of Pitesti and they form the Noble Gypsy family of Stanescu in Pitesti and Stankovich Gypsy family in Yugoslavia in Vojvodina.

Emil Mitchell mother who my Great Great Great Great Grandmother Madien name was her father name Yovanovich who was born 1810. Esma Redazpova family also came from the Yovanovich family they were Iraqi Gypsies and Jews with B Rh negative blood.

Yovanovich, Stankovich, Stanely and Mitchell are related to the B Rh negative, Senekerim Hovhannes or the Johns tribe that came form House of Varaz and Iranian-Armenian house that same Yazdegerd III Sassanian family and Senekerim Hovhannes and Shah Reza Pahlavi all are blood related to Solomon and Sheba the Jewish Exilarch Mar Abba daughter Shushandukt who Married Yazdegerd I and who descendant Yazegerd III had the Exilarch Y Chromosome J1b or J1a which Gypsies have. His daughter being descend of Exilarch related Solomon had (HLA-A2901) and Queen of Sheba(HLA-B4201) and B Rh negative the both Exilarch have a extremly high percent and Ethiopia Jewish who B Rh negative at 1%. Both Nazbanu and her brother Pirooz who fled to China were both B Rh negative like My mother and me I am B Rh negative carrier of half-blooded Prince of Many Royal family from the Ethiopian jews, the Exilarch to Sassanian Nobles, to the Bagratuni claim of Davidic descent the from the House of Varaz and Iranian-Armenian House Senekerim Hovhannes of Vaspurkhan or "Land of Princes" the was the homeland of Boyash gypsies after leaving Basra and Persia. Come from the Boyar of Vlad Dracula Basarab and Boyar Stan or Stanca Basarab and Logofat de Pitesti and the Stanescu who are B Rh negative too.

Zdravo,

My last name is Yovanovich (Jovanovic) and my ancestors are from a village near Bela Crkva in Banat in Vojvodina.

Do I count as a Serb to the people here? (I count as a Serb to the Serbian government, I'm eligible for Serbian citizenship even though my family has been in the States for almost 100 years)

CyberSpec

01-18-2006, 07:32 AM

Zdravo,

if your going to look up your geneology,the key is our families names before we came over on the boats.my grandfather willie jones said that the joneses last name was yovanovich.the boat captain gave us the last name of jones because they couldn't spell yovanovich.i also found out that yovanovich means "son of john" in our european heritage.

i hope that helps.anna morgan took alot of the old country with her when she passed away.yous need to hurry before it all goes away with the old folks.lol.

peace out

I am a Stanley. I have cousins who are Yovanovich. (Also= Davis, Mitchell) Maybe we are related

My last name is Yovanovich (Jovanovic) and my ancestors are from a village near Bela Crkva in Banat in Vojvodina. HLA-A2901 and and HLA-B4201 and B Rh negative in found in Vojvodina but also in Romania.

Do I count as a Serb to the people here? (I count as a Serb to the Serbian government, I'm eligible for Serbian citizenship even though my family has been in the States for almost 100 years)

I guess you're Serbian-American or is it American-Serbian ?

In any case, Blood is thicker than water...Welcome to the clan

Yovanovich are Satem Aryan Tocharians.

There was Yovanovichs are Queen of the all the Gypsies with the mtDNA L haplogroup or L-M11 from the Persian Royal family from Pars Persia and Karachi from the Parsi. They have same HLA-A2901 and HLA-B4201 both in the Oltenia and the Banat in Vojvodina. But is found in Boyash and Machawaya Gypsies the King all the Gypsies with Royal Persian bloodline that goes back Yazdegerd III daughter Nazbanu who was mtDNA L-M11 from Medes-Persian dating far back Darius I King of Persia more than 2500 years. HLA-A2901 and HLA-B4201 and Rh ryr B Rh negative come from the Jewish Exilarch who have Gutian-Tocharian origins with Rh ryr B Rh negative. The Yovanovich are the real Kings and Queen of all the Gypsies and Jews and Satem Aryan Tocharian or Aranoi or Aryan Gypsies.

YOVAN YOVANOVICH-ZMAY

1833- 1904

Mashhur serb shoiri Zmay

Salomia May Mitchell was actually Salomia ZMay Yovanovich form the Greek Gypsy tribe. Ludari George Mitchell AKA Yovanovich and Emil Mitchel mother Salomia ZMay-Yovanovich were related and also the Stanley or Stankovich, Mikanovich, and Yovanovich all originated form the from Bosnia in Olt Country or Oltenia region from Curtea de Arges called Băeşi or Boyash or Armenian Gypsies. Boyash Gypsies are unique because they don't speak Roma. They said they never have. "why" because they are Persian Gypsies or the Banu Sasan or sons of Sāsān. Another explanation says that the Persian nation as a whole took to begging and vagabondage after the Arab conquest of the 1st/7th century and excited pity by claiming to be descendants of the dispossessed Sasanian house, and the process whereby the name of a fallen dynasty is satirically or ironically applied to a subsequent group seems psychologically possible.

The Armenian Gypsy Persia the went to Lustiana was B rh negative the Part 1.

Mohammad Reza Shah Pahlavi mother Tadj ol-Molouk of Iran (born Nimtaj Ayromlou) was Ayrum Azeri from Baku of Jewish Bagratid descent from the House of David; Hence B Rh negative and Luekemia and My family who came from the last Zoroastrian King Yazdegerd III with(J1a or J1b Bostanai the Exilarch iraqi jewish blood)who daughters Nikabanu and Nazbanu from Fars Persia who fled to Deval or Karachi in Sindh Pronvince in what is now Pakistan. After the Banu Sasan or Persian Royal Gypsy family fled from from Karachi in 1010 A.D. to Armenian and intermarried with Armenian Bagratid Kings from the kingdom of Vaspurakan there Kingdom was annexed by the Turks and his Royal Iranian-Armenian Gypsy daughter were married of to European Royalty. The Armenien princess who could make a peregrination to Santiago de

Compostela circa 1021 would a daughter of Senek'erim Hovhannes

Artsrouni, king of Vaspourakan (1018), who in 1021 saw his kingdom

annexed by the emperor. This deposed armenian king, married to

Kouschkousch Bagratid( Gypsy Queen) B Rh negative., daughter of Gajik I, had several sons and

daughters, the majority later assassinated. One this Iranian-Armenian Gypsy princess married the King of Portugal Alfonso VI which lead to present of Alans or Iranian-Armenian present in Orlean France who from the House of Orleans and in Galicia and Great Galicia in Braga Portugal which the House of Braganza together they were House Orleans-Braganza from Dom Perdo II and Kalderash Portuguese gypsies or House of Braganza came from in Rio de Janiero who to New Orleans in 1860 and arrived in New Orleans or the House of Orleans in 1862 who leader Emil Mitchell became King all Gypsies in United States and his son Frank Mitchell who half Creole(Orleans) and Brazilian Gypsy (Braganza) became King all the Gypsies after Emil Death in 1942. Mohammad Reza Shah Pahlavi mother Tadj ol-Molouk of Iran (born Nimtaj Ayromlou) was Ayrum Azeri from Baku of Jewish Bagratid descent from the House of David and they came from the Iranian-Armenian royal lineage with J1b or J1a haplogroup with B Rh negative found in Shah Reza Pahalavi family Senekerim Hovhannes the Artrouni King of Vaspourakan who kingdom was annexed the Byzentine King.

Part 2 Second tribe the Boyash or Senekerim Hovhannes or Yovanovich tribe.

in what is now Pakistan. After the Banu Sasan or Persian Royal Gypsy family fled from from Karachi in 1010 A.D. to Armenian and intermarried with Armenian Bagratid Kings from the kingdom of Vaspurakan there Kingdom was annexed by the Turks and his Royal Iranian-Armenian Gypsy daughter were married of to European Royalty. The Armenien princess who could make a peregrination to Santiago de

Artsrouni, king of Vaspourakan (1018), who in 1021 saw his kingdom

annexed by the emperor. This deposed armenian king, married to

HOVHANNES

GENDER: Masculine

USAGE: Armenian

OTHER SCRIPTS: Հովհաննես, Յովհաննէս (Armenian)

Meaning & History

Armenian form of Iohannes (see JOHN).

Related Names

Show Family Tree

VARIANT: Ohannes

What does Hovhannes mean?

Meaning of the name Hovhannes

[ syll. hov-han-nes, ho-vhann-es ] The baby boy name Hovhannes is pronounced as HHAOVHHAEN-Z . Hovhannes is an Armenian name of Hebrew origin.

Hovhannes is an Armenian variant transcription of the name Johannes (Dutch, German, and Scandinavian).

Hovhannes is also an Armenian variant transcription of the name John (English and Hebrew).

Hovhannes is rare as a baby boy name. It is not listed in the top 1000. Out of the family of boy names directly linked to Hovhannes, John was the most frequently used in 2011.

Baby names that sound like Hovhannes include He-ping (Chinese), Hovannes (Armenian), and Hovennes.

 approx English pronunciation for Hovhannes: HH as in "he (HH.IY)" ; AO as in "ought (AO.T)" ; V as in "vow (V.AW)" ; AE as in "at (AE.T)" ; N as in "knee (N.IY)" ; Z as in "zoo (Z.UW)"

The Iraqi Gypsies trace their origins to Northern India, and Southern Persia. Their is a legend that states they were originally descendants of Persian nobles, whom lost their position when the Arabs defeated the Persians. According to the legend the last Sassanid emperor Yazgirid III recruited Jatts and Baluch soliders in order to be used against the Arabs. Thus these people were ennobled, and this was in order to defeat the Arabs. However the Arabs defeated them in the wars, and todays Gypsies are descendants of those knights who had fought for the Persian empire. The Iraqi Gypsy have some Zoroastrian influence upon their religion in which fire is considered scared, and their continual battle between good and evil.

The Iraqi Gypsy speak the Romani langauge, which has large amounts of Persian and Arab, loan words

The Iraqi Gypsies trace their origins to Northern India, and Southern Persia. Their is a legend that states they were originally descendants of Persian nobles, whom lost their position when the Arabs defeated the Persians. According to the legend the last Sassanid emperor Yazgirid III recruited Jatts and Baluch soliders in order to be used against the Arabs

BANŪ SĀSĀN, a name frequently applied in medieval Islam to beggars, rogues, charlatans, and tricksters of all kinds, allegedly so called because they stemmed from a legendary Shaikh Sāsān. A story frequently found in the sources, from Ebn al-Moqaffaʿ onward, states that Sāsān was the son of the ancient Persian ruler Bahman b. Esfandīār, but, being displaced from the succession, took to a wandering life and gathered round him other vagabonds, thus forming the sons of Sāsān. Another explanation says that the Persian nation as a whole took to begging and vagabondage after the Arab conquest of the 1st/7th century and excited pity by claiming to be descendants of the dispossessed Sasanian house, and the process whereby the name of a fallen dynasty is satirically or ironically applied to a subsequent group seems psychologically possible. Further etymologies have been sought in Sanskrit and in Persian itself (see Bosworth, I, pp. 22-24).

The Banū Sāsān, as depicted for us in such works of Arab adab literature as those of Jāḥeẓ, Ebrāhīm b. Moḥammad Bayhaqī, Abū Dolaf, and the maqāmāt of Badīʿ-al-Zamān Hamaḏānī and Ḥarīrī, must have rangedwhether in groups or as individualsall over the Islamic lands and as far as the borders of India. Specifically in regard to the Iranian lands, the beggar leader Ḵāled b. Yazīd in Jāḥeẓs Ketāb al-boḵalāʾ boasts that he has in the course of his life headed bands of robbers and desperadoes from the outlaws and bandits of Jebāl, of the Baṭṭ river region in Ḵūzestān, of the Kūfečīs (q.v.) of Kermān and Baluchistan, and the pirates of Qīqān of the Makrān coast. In almost all the literature relevant to the Banū Sāsān, the Kurds are singled out as the nation of predators and brigands par excellence, and Ḵāled b. Yazīd in his enumeration of the beggar leaders mentions Jaʿfar Kordī among various others with Persian names, such as Banjawayh, Ḥammawayh, Sahrām, Saʿdawayh, Mardawayh, etc. From Abū Dolafs poem (see below), it emerges that the Kābolis (or perhaps in this context, the Indians in general) were especially famed as jugglers and conjurors (see Jāḥeẓ, Boḵalāʾ, ed. Ṭaha Ḥājerī, Cairo, 1958, pp. 46, 50, tr. Ch. Pellat, Le livre des avares, Paris, 1951, pp. 66, 71; Bosworth, I, pp. 34ff., 93-94, 171).
